intro: Ludwigia virgata, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and can vary in color from green to reddish depending on light exposure. Ludwigia virgata is popular in aquatic gardens and is sometimes used as a decorative plant in ponds and water features.
